oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ab initio and density functional theory evidence on the rate-limiting step in the Morita-Baylis-Hiliman reaction
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ROY, D
SUNOJ, RB
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: hillman reaction
rate acceleration
mechanism
catalysis
solvents
water
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The first ab initio and DFT studies on the mechanism of the MBH reaction show that the rate-limiting step involves an intramolecular proton transfer in the zwitterionic intermediate generated by the addition of enolate to electrophile. The activation barrier for the C-C bond-formation is found to be 20.2 kcal/mol lower than the proton-transfer step for the MBH reaction between methyl vinyl ketone and benzaldehyde catalyzed by DABCO.
